column2: and the first chapter of ''[[The Lays of Beleriand]]''.
published in 1985 (the third volume of [[Christopher Tolkien]]'s 12-volume series
column4: contains the long "lays" or poems Tolkien wrote: these are the ''Lay of the Children of Húrin'' about the saga of [[Túrin|Túrin Turambar]]
column5: and ''[[The Lay of Leithian]]'' (also called ''Release from Bondage'') about [[Beren]] and [[Lúthien]]. Although Tolkien abandoned both of these before their respective ends
column6: they are both long enough to occupy many stanzas
column7: each of which can last for over 10 pages.

column1: The first tale is in alliterative verse
column2: and the second is in rhyming couplets. Both exist in two versions. In addition to these two poems
